armor.name: Vaccsuit
armor.special: Includes short-range comms, headlamp, and radiation shielding. Decompression within 1d5 rounds if punctured.

armor.name: Hazard Suit
armor.description: Environmental protection while exploring unknown planets.
armor.special: Includes air filter, extreme heat/cold protection, hydration reclamation (1L of water lasts 4 days), short-range comms, headlamp, and radiation shielding.

armor.name: Standard Battle Dress
armor.description: Lightly-plated armor worn by most marines.

armor.name: Advanced Battle Dress
armor.description: Heavy armor for marines deployed in high combat offworld engagements.
armor.special: Includes short-range comms, body cam, headlamp, HUD, exoskeletal weave (Strength Checks [+]), and radiation shielding. Damage Reduction: 3.

equipment.name: Assorted Tools
equipment.description: Wrenches, spanners, screwdrivers, etc. Can be used as weapons in a pinch (1d5 DMG).

equipment.name: Automed (x5)
equipment.description: Nanotech pills that assist your body in repairing Damage by granting Advantage to Body Saves meant to repel disease and poison, as well as attempts to heal from rest.

equipment.name: Battery (High Power)
equipment.description: Heavy duty battery used for powering laser cutters, salvage drones, and other items. Can be recharged in 1 hour if connected to power or in 6 hours with solar power. Add waterproofing (+500cr).

equipment.name: Binoculars
equipment.description: 20x magnification. Add night vision (+300cr) or thermal vision (+1kcr).

equipment.name: Bioscanner
equipment.description: Long Range. Allows the user to scan for signs of life. Can tell the location of signs of life, but not what that life is. Blocked by some materials at the Warden's discretion.

npcs.name: The 4YourEyez Algorithm
npcs.description: Every human communication network is infected. This Trojan horse spyware spreads like a virus, but desires secrecy above disruption… or perhaps, only secrecy. Of course, as it spreads, the lurking worm becomes more vulnerable to exposure, which drives it to greater and greater extremes. This may simply be a mindless program, secretive for secrecy’s sake… or it may be simply the veil hiding something greater, such as an intelligence community conspiracy or a breakaway AI culture.

npcs.name: Angels

attacks.name: Trumpets
attacks.effect: Sanity Save [-] or fall to knees weeping.

npcs.description:
Some long term spacers, veterans of FTL, claim to have witnessed great gates opening like hateful eyes across space, often accompanied by a sense of true and transcendent purpose: the awakening of an ancient adversary, whose obscured hand stretches across a history longer than night.
Some seek signs of their visions’ truth, hidden relics and weapons to aid in ‘the Great War.’ Few return. Those who do are transfigured, and speak in reverent awe of communing with a consciousness whose voice is the fluttering of a million wings, whose memory predates the dust between stars, an impression of kaleidoscopic eyes and teeth, the light that will burn away the dark between the stars. Our destiny.

npcs.name: Belladonnas

specialAbilities.description: Tail Poison: Body Saved [-] or 1d10 DMG/round.

npcs.description: Four wings tipped with razor sharp talons. Flat black, smooth, angular. Can see in the dark via a row of sensing organs along their skinny, wide heads. Their tails end in several long blades, coated in mind-dulling toxin. Can spit hot blood that they can track. Hate light sources. Strong light, including sunlight, causes damage to their tissues and blinds them. Attracted to moving prey, and ignore targets standing absolutely still.

npcs.name: The Body Politic
npcs.description: Each sapient zooid of this colonial organism replaces an organ of its host, but they do not form a collective consciousness. Instead, the members of this “Parliament” vote on the body’s conduct through their legislative neurons. This network evolved from an organ-trafficking ring’s diagnostic system, after its AI decided that human space needed to be brought democracy and universal suffrage... down to the cellular level. A body politic can replace an organ of an unconscious captive with one of its constituents, a “slaver organ.” A heart is the most desirable choice, though the slaving takes roughly an hour to occur. A simpler method is replacing the tonsils in only five minutes, co-opting it into a type of biochemical time bomb that will release fatal botulinum and tetanus toxins in case of non-compliance.

npcs.name: The Brown Stream (video)
npcs.description: There are rumors of a film deconstructed across networks, logged and filed by the devoted, its sequence, meaning, and purpose hotly debated, incomplete archives everywhere. New footage allegedly flickers on abandoned stations media servers, restricted access Lagrange points, pirate signals, abandoned HD screens. Garish color with strange scoring, nonsensical voice overs intercut with animated propaganda rehearsals, distracted idols, cheap novelty manufacture, routine violence, tourist attractions, dated advertising, war tourism, plastic surgery. It opens a looking glass world of violence and conspiracies to the illuminated.

npcs.name: C-Levels
npcs.description: There's no need for conspiracy when people with shared goals act within their own self interest. Only profit. They're flesh and blood, just like you and me. Which means they can be killed, made to suffer. If you could get at them. Find them. Past the private army, private planet, private fortress, private fleet. Find them and ask them why should they get to live free from consequence?

npcs.name: Cabin 102-B

specialAbilities.description: Sanity Save each hour spent inside Cabin 102-B.

npcs.description: Before the passenger liner Arcturus broke open from a catastrophic hull breach, the concierge recorded something impossible. A new cabin had appeared aboard—Cabin 102-B, locked. The last recorded work order was the concierge taking out a small laser cutter to investigate.

npcs.name: Chronopods

specialAbilities.description: Use Sanity Save instead of Combat during violent encounters.

npcs.description: Tall, dark, fleshy columns supported by seven thick legs branching off into smaller and smaller appendages. Thick, wrinkled skin pocketed with orifices of unknown abilities. Time passes differently for these very intelligent beings, so combat with them is nearly impossible for those experiencing linear time. Large, weird eyes covered with layers of skin. Can cause focused time distortions to destroy equipment and weird aging upon humans (in both directions).

npcs.name: Demons

specialAbilities.description: Whisper: Fear Save or take current Stress as DMG.

npcs.description: The frequency is found, after years of trying. The ham radio hisses and spits. Slick drips from the speakers. The lights pulse and flicker. Sibilant voices promise unspeakable things, freedom from the drudgery and misery of wage slavery. The crew unflesh themselves, mumbling prayers. Something is born from the bloody ruin-wet fur, many-jointed limbs, an iron mask cast of their former face. They wear their old skin as cloaks and finery.

weapons.name: Combat Shotgun
weapons.special: 1d10 DMG at Long Range or greater.

weapons.name: Crowbar
weapons.special: Grants [+] on Strength Checks to open jammed airlocks, lift heavy objects, etc.

weapons.name: Flamethrower
weapons.special: Body Save [-] or be set on fire (2d10 DMG / round).

weapons.name: Flare Gun
weapons.special: High intensity flare visible day and night from Long Range.
